required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: rPlan Multimedia Dual Protection Intervention to Reduce Health Disparities
clinical_study.official_title: rPlan Multimedia Dual Protection Intervention to Reduce Health Disparities

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators will develop a digital application (app)—"rPlan dual protection" (rPlan)—to be used in the clinic waiting room prior to a gynecological and/or contraceptive visit. The goal of this research is to develop the app and conduct a feasibility, acceptability and effectiveness assessment of rPlan to examine improvement in dual method use, enhancement of contraceptive adherence and continuation, increase of condom use and decrease of sexually transmitted infection (STI) and human immunodeficiency virus(HIV) infection. The research will consist of baseline activities as well as 6 week phone call and 12 week in-clinic survey and STI test, as well as a retrospective chart review.

detailed_description.textblock:
Using the investigators' experience in digital media, behavior theory, client-centered interventions, and family planning, the investigators will develop a digital application ("app")—rPlan—to be used in the clinic waiting room prior to a gynecological and/or contraceptive visit. The goal of this research is to develop the app and conduct a feasibility, acceptability and effectiveness assessment of rPlan.
This study will develop rPlan, a three-part intervention that includes a precounseling app that promotes dual protection, motivational interviewing-informed counseling, and concomitant printed educational materials.
The research will proceed in two phases. In Phase I, the investigators will assemble a 10-member stakeholder advisory team to enhance the PreCounselor app to focus on dual protection, train reproductive health counselors in motivational interviewing, and create concomitant printed educational materials. In Phase II, the feasibility, acceptability, and effectiveness of the intervention will be assessed. The specific aims are to:
Aim 1: Develop the rPlan intervention by (1) enhancing the pretested PreCounselor app to focus on dual protection, (2) training reproductive health counselors, and (3) creating concomitant printed educational materials.
Aim 2: Conduct a pre/post feasibility, acceptability, and effectiveness assessment of rPlan to examine improvement in dual method use, enhancement of contraceptive adherence and continuation, increase of condom use, and decrease of STI/HIV infection.
The primary outcome is dual method use, which will be measured via patient report at 6 weeks and 12 weeks post enrollment. The secondary outcomes are contraceptive adherence/uptake (measured at 6 and 12 weeks post enrollment), frequency of unprotected penile-vaginal/anal intercourse (PVI/PAI) (measured at 6 and 12 weeks post enrollment, and risk reduction behaviors (measured at 6 and 12 weeks post enrollment), decisional balance/self-efficacy (measured at 12 weeks post enrollment), and STI infection (12 weeks post enrollment).
The research will consist of baseline activities as well as 6 week phone call and 12 week in-clinic survey and STI test, as well as a retrospective chart review to capture interceding visits (e.g., initial contraceptive method selection, method switching, etc.) and diagnoses (e.g., pregnancy, STI/HIV).

primary_outcome.description: frequency of use of condoms and contraceptive method (measured by self-report, 5 option close-ended question)

secondary_outcome.description: frequency of use of condoms and contraceptive method for vaginal or anal sex (measured by self-report, 5 option close-ended question)
frequency of use of contraceptive methods (measured by self-report, 5 option close-ended question)
infection with sexually transmitted disease (measured by STI test, at enrollment and at 12 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: change in self-efficacy for contraception at 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: change in self efficacy for contraceptive method use (measured via validated 5-item attitudinal scale by Galavotti et al 1995) from baseline to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: change in self-efficacy for condom use at 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: change in self efficacy for condom use (measured via validated 5-item attitudinal scale by Galavotti et al 1995) from baseline to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: change in decisional balance for highly effective contraceptive methods at 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: change in decisional balance for highly effective methods (measured via validated 10-item attitudinal scale by Galavotti et al 1995) from baseline to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: change in decisional balance for condoms at 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: change in decisional balance for condom use (measured via validated 10-item attitudinal scale by Galavotti et al 1995) from baseline to 12 weeks
number of sexual partners (measured via self report, past 3 months)

arm_group.description: Participants will complete a 10-15 minute questionnaire . After completing the questionnaire, a research assistant (RA) will provide a brief orientation to the rPlan app and use the rPlan app for up to 15 minutes. After viewing rPlan, participants will be asked a series of questions regarding the app's usability, helpfulness, and content appropriateness (10 min). The participant will also be given an STI test.

intervention.intervention_name: rPlan dual protection waiting room app intervention

overall_official.affiliation: University of Chicago, Dept. of OBGYN
